page.title: 10THE METHODIST CHURCH
page.content: The Methodist Church was built in 1930 for the sum of Â£1900.It was lit by paraffin lamps, until electricity came to the village. It now has a membership of 20, and two services are held each Sunday. A kitchen was added in 1982 at a cost of Â£625. The Harvest Festival is a highlight of the year, when the Church is beautifully decorated - a special feature being the hanging corn, threaded through by string. Parish Councillors and Young Farmers take part in the service. The Wesley Guild meets fortnightly during the winter. Friends from the Anglican Church and other denominations join in. A new building has been proposed alongside the Church for a Sunday School.
